sentences.en: a song with a beat you can dance to
sentences.cn: 带有舞蹈节奏的一首歌曲

sentences.en: Beat down the seller to the price that suits you.
sentences.cn: 把卖家的要价砍到你能接受的价格。

sentences.en: Blend the butter with the sugar and beat until light and creamy.
sentences.cn: 把糖掺入黄油然后搅拌至滑软细腻。

sentences.en: Brazil were beaten 2–1.
sentences.cn: 巴西队以1比2告负。

sentences.en: Go on lads, beat the living daylights out of them!
sentences.cn: 上啊，伙计们，狠狠揍他们一顿！

sentences.en: Guests bopped and jigged the night away to the disco beat.
sentences.cn: 客人们整个晚上随着迪斯科的节奏跳博普舞和吉格舞。

sentences.en: He beat Thomas Muster of Austria three sets to love.
sentences.cn: 他3比0直取奥地利的托马斯·蒙斯特。

sentences.en: He beat up on my brother's kid one time.
sentences.cn: 他有一次殴打了我哥的孩子。

sentences.en: He pounced on the photographer, beat him up and smashed his camera.
sentences.cn: 他突然扑向摄影师，痛打了他一顿，还摔碎了他的照相机。

sentences.en: He was questioned and beaten.
sentences.cn: 他受到了审问和拷打。

sentences.en: Hibernian clinched the First Division title when they beat Hamilton 2-0.
sentences.cn: 希伯尼安队以2比0战胜汉密尔顿队，夺得了甲级联赛的冠军。

sentences.en: His brother beat out the flames with a blanket.
sentences.cn: 他哥哥用毯子把火扑灭了。

sentences.en: It was a close run thing before Spain beat Poland 3-2.
sentences.cn: 比赛难分高下，最终西班牙以3比2击败波兰。

sentences.en: It won't shake the football world if we beat Torquay.
sentences.cn: 即便我们击败了托基队也不能撼动足球界。

sentences.en: Jennifer’s heart was beating fast.
sentences.cn: 珍妮弗心跳得很快。

sentences.en: journalists covering the Washington beat
sentences.cn: 驻华盛顿地区的新闻记者

sentences.en: Labour easily beat the Conservatives in the last election.
sentences.cn: 工党在上一届选举中轻松击败保守党。

sentences.en: photographs of rioters beating a policeman
sentences.cn: 暴徒殴打一名警察的照片

sentences.en: Somebody was beating at the door.
sentences.cn: 有人在打门。

sentences.en: The average person’s heart beats 70 times a minute.
sentences.cn: 一般人的心跳是一分钟70次。

sentences.en: The president beat his breast and called that deal a mistake.
sentences.cn: 总裁捶胸顿足，称那是个错误的交易。

sentences.en: The woman had been beaten to death by her husband.
sentences.cn: 那女子已被丈夫殴打致死。

sentences.en: They beat the Giants by a score of 7 to 3.
sentences.cn: 他们以7比3的比分击败了巨人队。

sentences.en: They beat them up and locked them in a cell.
sentences.cn: 他们殴打了他们，并把他们锁在一间囚室里。

sentences.en: Two prisoners were beaten unconscious .
sentences.cn: 两名囚犯被打昏过去。

sentences.en: Whenever she refused, he'd beat her black and blue.
sentences.cn: 只要她拒绝他，他就会把她打得青一块紫一块。

搅拌器；[纸] 打浆机；助猎者
打；[纸] 打浆；敲打；失败

打；打败；拍打；有节奏地舒张与收缩

phrases.tran_cn: （对令人不快的事情）避之唯恐不及

phrases.phrase: beat a path to someone's door
phrases.tran_cn: （大批的人）争先恐后地去接触，纷纷前去找（某人）
迎斜风行驶；搜索；四处闲逛；拐弯抹角
说话绕圈子，不直截了当地说
[口]意想不到；压倒一切；了不起
打倒；杀价；大雨倾盆而下；强烈地照射下来
美国“垮了的一代”；美国二战后的一代
&I{【棒球】} 安全上垒：使（短打或地滚球）成为安打

phrases.phrase: beat someone at their own game

phrases.tran_cn: 在某件事上占某人之先
(史)划定教区范围（围绕教区四周行走并用杆插入地面以划定界限）

phrases.phrase: beat the hell out of informal 非正式

phrases.tran_cn: [美俚]逃过刑事责任；摆脱困境
adj. 年久失修的；残破的

trans.tran_cn: 有节奏的跳动，敲击，节奏，节拍，辖区
trans.tran_en: one of a series of regular movements or hitting actions

trans.tran_cn: 打败，控制，难倒，突破，胜过，逃避，击打，作节奏运动，踩出（道路）
trans.tran_en: to get the most points, votes etc in a game, race, or competition
when your heart beats, it moves in a regular  rhythm  as it pumps your blood

trans.tran_cn: 打；打败，战胜；难倒，使无法解答
trans.tran_en: to get the most points, votes etc in a game, race, or competition
to get the most points, votes etc in a game, race, or competition
